data.title: Two Set Operations
data.solution:
# Author: StepBack13

set_1 = gets.chomp.split.map{|i| i.to_i }
operation = gets.chomp
set_2 = gets.chomp.split.map{|i| i.to_i }

result = eval("set_1 #{operation} set_2").sort.uniq

if result.empty?
  puts "{}"
else
  puts result*" "
end
data.statement:
A set of integers can interact with another set in 3 basic ways.

Here we use the operation symbols {{+-&}} and define them as below for sets:
{{+}} : Find their <<union>>, the set which contains all their members
{{-}} : Find their <<difference>>, the members of {{set_1}} which are not in {{set_2}}
{{&}} : Find their <<intersection>>, the shared members of both

You are given a three lines of [[input]]: [[set_1]] [[operation]] and [[set_2]] where [[operation]] is one of {{+-&}}. [[set_1]] and [[set_2]] are sorted sequences of space-separated integers representing the members of the set. Print the sorted final result of the corresponding operation or {{{}}} if the resulting set is empty
data.constraints:
All input sets will be valid and sorted
Sets must not contain duplicates
data.stubGenerator:
read set1:string(60)
read operation:string(1)
read set2:string(60)
write Answer

STATEMENT
Author: StepBack13

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A set of integers can interact with another set in 3 basic ways.

Here we use the operation symbols +-& and define them as below for sets:
+ : Find their union, the set which contains all their members
- : Find their difference, the members of set_1 which are not in set_2
& : Find their intersection, the shared members of both

You are given a three lines of input: set_1 operation and set_2 where operation is one of +-&. set_1 and set_2 are sorted sequences of space-separated integers representing the members of the set. Print the sorted final result of the corresponding operation or {} if the resulting set is empty
Input
Line 1 : A sorted sequence of space-separated integers named set_1
Line 2 : An operation, which is one of +-&
Line 3 : A sorted sequence of space-separated integers named set_2
Output
1 line : The sorted final result of the corresponding set operation, space-separated; or {} if result is empty.
Constraints
All input sets will be valid and sorted
Sets must not contain duplicates
Example
Input
1 2 4
+
3 5
Output
1 2 3 4 5
